p: Medicinal plant use value ranged from 0.01 to 0.14. Elaeis guineensis Jacq., (0.14), Mondia whitei (Hook. f.) Skeels (0.10), Ocimum gratissimum L., (0.08), and Pentadiplandra brazzeana Baillon (0.06) are the most important species in the traditional Kongo pharmacopeia, with UVs > 0.05 (Fig. 4a). The informant agreement on plant use ranged 0.1 to 1. Dioscorea smilacifolia De Wild. & T. Durand, Abelmoschus esculentus (L.) Moench, Corymbia citriodora (Hook.) K. D. Hill & L. A. S. Johnson, Garcinia kola Heckel, Musanga cecropioides R. Br., Steganotaenia araliacea Hochst, Strychnos pungens Soler., and Datura stramonium L. have the maximum IAR-value of 1 (Fig. 4b). They represent the species with the highest level of consensus for their use as a remedy for diabetes, cough, epilepsy, laryngitis, hernia, elephantiasis, hair yellowing, and tooth decay, respectively.
